sentence.Network_en: Alex jumped up so violently that he overturned his glass of sherry.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚历克斯一下子暴跳起来，结果把他那杯雪利酒都打翻了。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly she gave a low, choking moan and began to tremble violently.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然，她发出了一声低沉而哽咽的呻吟，然后剧烈地颤抖起来。

sentence.Network_en: In Petersburg, 30 patrolmen have died violently in the past five years.
sentence.Network_cn: 在彼得斯堡，过去5年中有30名巡警死于暴力事件。

entry.def: If someone is violent, or if they do something which is violent, they use physical force or weapons to hurt, injure, or kill other people.

example.ex: A quarter of current inmates have committed violent crimes.
example.tran: 现在关押的犯人中有1/4是暴力犯罪。

entry.def: A violent event happens suddenly and with great force.

example.ex: A violent impact hurtled her forward...
example.tran: 一股强大的冲击波把她向前抛去。

example.ex: A violent explosion seemed to jolt the whole ground.
example.tran: 剧烈的爆炸好像要把整个地面都掀起来。

entry.tran: （言行或感觉）激烈的，强烈的，狂暴的
entry.def: If you describe something as violent, you mean that it is said, done, or felt very strongly.

example.ex: Violent opposition to the plan continues...
example.tran: 对该计划的强烈反对之声仍不绝于耳。

entry.def: Violent changes are extreme changes from one state to another.

example.ex: Larry began suffering severe headaches and violent mood swings.
example.tran: 拉里开始出现严重的头痛和剧烈的情绪波动。

entry.tran: （死亡）痛苦的，突发性的，暴力造成的
entry.def: A violent death is painful and unexpected, usually because the person who dies has been murdered.

example.ex: ...an innocent man who had met a violent death.

entry.tran: （电影或电视节目）多暴力镜头的，渲染暴力的
entry.def: A violent film or television programme contains a lot of scenes which show violence.

example.ex: It was the most violent film that I have ever seen.
example.tran: 这是我看过的最暴力的一部电影。

entry.tran: （色彩）强烈的，刺目的，鲜艳夺目的
entry.def: If you describe a colour as violent, you mean that it is extremely, and often unpleasantly, bright.

example.tran: 夕阳将逝时夺目的红色

entry.def: Violent weather is extremely stormy and windy.

example.ex: A violent storm had struck the area.
example.tran: 一场猛烈的暴风雨席卷了该地区。

auth_sentence.content: Do feel free to vomit violently into a bucket.
auth_sentence.res_content: Do feel free to vomit violently into a bucket.

auth_sentence.content: The coughing girl is shaking her curly head violently.
auth_sentence.res_content: The coughing girl is shaking her curly head violently.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The coughing girl is shaking her curly head violently.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 猛烈的, 激烈的, 暴力引起的, 强暴的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 猛烈地, 激烈地, 极端地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 违反, 违背, 妨碍

sentences.en: Her heart beat violently when she received the letter.
sentences.cn: 接到这封信,她的心跳得很厉害。

sentences.en: They have come into conflict, sometimes violently.
sentences.cn: 他们产生了矛盾,有时矛盾还非常激烈。

sentences.en: Her horse shied violently at a gorse bush.
sentences.cn: 金雀花丛把她的马惊得猛然后退。

sentences.en: This drug can make some people violently ill.
sentences.cn: 这药使用后会使一些人感到极其不舒服。
